Package it.polimi.ingsw.server.controller.weapons

Class FixedDirectionTargetCalculator

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.ingsw.server.controller.weapons.FixedDirectionTargetCalculator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TargetCalculator
    public class FixedDirectionTargetCalculator
extends java.lang.Object
implements TargetCalculator
    This class is a TargetCalculator that finds targets in a straight line from the starting point

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private Board board
      The Board on which targets can be found
      private Direction direction
      This property saves the direction that shall be considered when computing the targets, if null the calculator will consider all directions
      private boolean goesThroughWalls
      Whether the calculator should stop looking in a Direction when a wall is found

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      FixedDirectionTargetCalculator​(Board board, boolean goesThroughWalls)
      This constructor does not set a specific direction
      FixedDirectionTargetCalculator​(Board board, boolean goesThroughWalls, Direction direction)
      This constructor sets the direction that shall be considered when computing the target

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      private void addBlocks​(Block startingPoint, java.util.Set<Block> blocks, Direction direction)
      Adds the blocks on which potential targets can be found to the Set blocks passed as a parameter
      java.util.Set<Player> computeTargets​(Block startingPoint, Weapon weapon)
      This method returns the groups of players that can be targeted by the Attack solely based on their position in a straight direction from the starting point
      boolean contains​(TargetCalculator calculator)
      Determines whether another TargetCalculator is contained in this calculator
      java.util.List<TargetCalculator> getSubCalculators()
      Gets the list of calculators contained in this calculator
      private Attack needToUpdate​(Weapon weapon)
      Returns the Attack, previously executed by weapon, that has used this calculator
      void setDirection​(Direction direction)
      This method sets the direction of the targets to a new value
      private void updateDirection​(Block startingPoint, Weapon weapon)
      Updates the Direction this calculator will consider, if necessary

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • computeTargets

        public java.util.Set<Player> computeTargets​(Block startingPoint,
                                            Weapon weapon)
        This method returns the groups of players that can be targeted by the Attack solely based on their position in a straight direction from the starting point
        Specified by:
        computeTargets in interface TargetCalculator
        Parameters:
        startingPoint - the Block relative to which the targets should be
        weapon - the Weapon that will be used to shoot
        Returns:
        a list of the available groups of targets, which will be empty if none are available

      • addBlocks

        private void addBlocks​(Block startingPoint,
                       java.util.Set<Block> blocks,
                       Direction direction)
        Adds the blocks on which potential targets can be found to the Set blocks passed as a parameter
        Parameters:
        startingPoint - the Block relative to which the targets should be
        blocks - the Set that will be updated
        direction - the Direction to consider

      • contains

        public boolean contains​(TargetCalculator calculator)
        Determines whether another TargetCalculator is contained in this calculator
        Specified by:
        contains in interface TargetCalculator
        Parameters:
        calculator - the TargetCalculator that might be contained in this
        Returns:
        true if this calculator contains the given calculator, false otherwise

      • setDirection

        public void setDirection​(@Nullable
                         Direction direction)
        This method sets the direction of the targets to a new value
        Parameters:
        direction - the value of Direction that will be used when computing targets, or null to reset it

      • updateDirection

        private void updateDirection​(Block startingPoint,
                             Weapon weapon)
        Updates the Direction this calculator will consider, if necessary
        Parameters:
        startingPoint - the starting point of the attack
        weapon - the weapon this calculator is used for

      • needToUpdate

        @Nullable
private Attack needToUpdate​(Weapon weapon)
        Returns the Attack, previously executed by weapon, that has used this calculator
        Parameters:
        weapon - the weapon that is using this calculator
        Returns:
        the Attack that has used this calculator, null if none did
